feed.title: Eurostat - Custom RSS Feed
feed.subtitle: This feed has been created based on your search query. For more information, please consult the related help page.

entry.title: How much do EU foreign affiliates generate in net turnover?
entry.summary: In 2022, EU market producer enterprises controlled by countries outside the EU generated a net turnover of €5 657 billion, equivalent to 14.7% of all net turnover generated by EU enterprises (€38 494 billion). At the same time, enterprises outside the EU, controlled by an EU resident institutional...

entry.title: EU sees record number of tourism nights in 2024
entry.summary: In 2024, the estimated number of nights spent at tourist accommodation establishments in the EU reached 2.99 billion, exceeding the previous year by 53.4 million, or 2%. The growth in tourism nights was mainly driven by an increase in nights spent by international guests (+58.7 million), while the ...

entry.title: Nights booked via online platforms up 18% in Q3 2024
entry.summary: During the third quarter of 2024, guests spent 366.2 million nights in short-term rental accommodation in the EU, booked via Airbnb, Booking, Expedia Group or Tripadvisor. This corresponds to an increase of 18% compared with the same period in 2023. All 3 months in the third quarter of 2024 recorde...

entry.title: 62% EU foreign affiliates’ turnover made outside the EU
entry.summary: In 2022, among the foreign affiliates controlled by the institutional units resident in the EU, 52.5% were located outside the EU. The highest share of enterprises active outside the EU were reported for enterprises controlled by Ireland (65.7%), Spain and Croatia (61.8% each). The lowest shares w...

entry.title: Total market production decreased in September 2024
entry.summary: In September 2024, the total market production decreased by 0.6% in the EU and by 0.7% in the euro area compared with the previous month. The total market production index (TMPI) is a composite indicator that combines 4 short-term business statistics indicators covering most of the market economy, ...

entry.title: Large businesses make up only 0.2% of EU enterprises
entry.summary: In 2023, the EU had around 33 million enterprises, employing 163 million persons. Those enterprises registered a net turnover of over €38 trillion. Large enterprises (more than 249 persons employed) represented only 0.2% of the total number of enterprises in the EU’s business economy (53 000 enter...

entry.title: More than half of EU businesses are innovation-active
entry.summary: 51% of all enterprises in the EU reported that they had some form of innovation activity during the years 2020 to 2022, according to the Community Innovation Survey (CIS). The CIS reports about product and process innovation in businesses in the EU. The latest CIS shows that Belgium had the high...

entry.title: Foreign enterprises contribute notably to the EU economy
entry.summary: In 2022, 1% of EU market producer enterprises were under foreign control. More than half, 63%, were controlled by institutional units from other EU countries, while 37% were resident outside the EU. Even if small in numbers, foreign-controlled enterprises contributed significantly to the EU economy...

entry.title: EU production of bicycles down to 9.7 million in 2023
entry.summary: Cycling is an eco-friendly and health-conscious mode of transportation with many fans. In 2023, 9.7 million bicycles were produced in the EU, a 24% decrease in bicycle production compared with 2022 (12.7 million). Looking at the available non-confidential data, the biggest producer of bicycles in 2...

entry.title: Increase in bankruptcies and registrations in Q3 2024
entry.summary: In the third quarter of 2024, the number of bankruptcy declarations of EU businesses increased by 2.7% compared with the second quarter of 2024. At the same time, business registrations also went up by 2.2% compared with the second quarter of 2024. This information comes from data on business re...

entry.title: More businesses opened than dissolved in the EU in 2022
entry.summary: In 2022, there was a total of over 32 million enterprises in the EU, 3.4 million new enterprises were born that year, and according to the preliminary data, 2.8 million enterprise deaths were registered. The enterprise birth rate was 10.5% while the preliminary rate of enterprise deaths stood at 8.7...
